children.name: Acis
children.description: river god (potamoi; ποταμοί)

children.name: Pan
children.description: god of shepherds, pastures, and fertility

children.name: Aether
children.description: god of light and the upper atmosphere

children.name: Chaos
children.description: personification of nothingness from which all of existence sprang

children.name: Cronos
children.description: god of empirical time, sometimes equated with aion

children.name: Erebus
children.description: god of darkness and shadow

children.name: Eros
children.description: god of love and attraction

children.name: Gaea
children.description: was the primordial earth or mother goddess who governed the universe before the titans existed

children.name: Hemera
children.description: goddess of day

children.name: Nemesis
children.description: goddess of retribution

children.name: Nyx
children.description: goddess of night

children.name: Pontus
children.description: god of the sea, father of the fish and other sea creatures

children.name: Thanatos
children.description: god of death

children.name: Uranus
children.description: god of the heavens (father sky); father of the titans

children.name: Aethra
children.description: one of the oceanids, the 3000 daughters of oceanus and tethys

children.name: Agave
children.description: one of the fifty nereids, sea-nymph

children.name: Ambrosia
children.description: a wood nymph, one of the three or five hyades, when she died she transformed into a vine

children.name: Clymene
children.description: the wife of the titan iapetus, one of the 3,000 oceanids

children.name: Doris
children.description: she was a sea goddess, one of the 3,000 Oceanids, daughters of the titans oceanus and tethys

children.name: Dryope
children.description: was a nymph of mount kyllene who was the mother by hermes of the goat-legged god pan. her father dryopos oak-face" was the craggy

children.name: Erythea
children.description: one of the hesperides, the nymphs of evening and golden light of sunsets, who were the daughters of the evening" or "nymphs of the west"

children.name: Eudora
children.description: was one of the hyades, the nymphs associated with the configuration of stars

children.name: Galatea
children.description: a sea-nymph, one of the fifty nereids (daughters of nereus)

children.name: Hesperia
children.description: one of the hesperides, nymphs of the evening and daughters of atlas

children.name: Io
children.description: a numph, priestess of hera, turned into a heifer by zeus to protect her from hera's jealousy

children.name: Melia
children.description: a nymph associated with ash trees, daughter of uranus and gaea (earth)

children.name: Nereus
children.description: sea nymph and  old man of the sea, and the god of the seas rich bounty of fish

children.name: Perse
children.description: one of the oceanids, daughters of oceanus and tethys

children.name: Phyto
children.description: a naiad nymph,one of the hesperides, associated with plants and vegetation

children.name: Pleione
children.description: an oceanid nymph, wife of atlas, and mother of the pleiades

children.name: Proto
children.description: the nereid of the first or maiden voyage and one of the fifty marine-nymph

children.name: Symaethis
children.description: was the naiad-nymph of the river symaithos, in sicily. she was loved by the god pan

children.name: Amphitrite
children.description: sea goddess and consort of poseidon

children.name: Eurybia
children.description: described as having a heart of flint within her, she is an older, relatively minor deity

children.name: Thaumas
children.description: god of the wonders of the sea

children.name: Triton
children.description: fish-tailed son and herald of poseidon

children.name: Aphrodite
children.description: goddess of beauty, love, desire, and pleasure

children.name: Apollo
children.description: god of music, arts, knowledge, healing, plague, prophecy, poetry, manly beauty, and archery

children.name: Ares
children.description: god of courage, war, bloodshed, and violence

children.name: Artemis
children.description: virgin goddess of the hunt, wilderness, animals, the moon and young girls

children.name: Demeter
children.description: goddess of grain, agriculture, harvest, growth, and nourishment

children.name: Dionysus
children.description: god of wine, fruitfulness, parties, festivals, madness, chaos, drunkenness, vegetation, ecstasy, and the theater

children.name: Hades
children.description: god and king of the underworld and the dead

children.name: Hera
children.description: queen of the gods, and goddess of marriage, women, childbirth, heirs, kings, and empires

children.name: Hermes
children.description: god of boundaries, travel, communication, trade, language, thieves and writing

children.name: Hestia
children.description: virgin goddess of the hearth, home, and chastity

children.name: Poseidon
children.description: god of the sea, rivers, floods, droughts, and earthquakes

children.name: Zeus
children.description: king of the gods, ruler of mount olympus, and god of the sky, weather, thunder, lightning, law, order, and justice

children.name: Arion
children.description: is a divinely-bred, fabulously fast, black-maned horse, given to heracles

children.name: Circe
children.description: goddess-witch of aeaea

children.name: Hebe
children.description: goddess of youth and cup-bearer to the olympians

children.name: Latramys
children.description: son of the wine god dionysus and his wife ariadne

children.name: Pasiphae
children.description: daughter of helios, wife of king minos, and mother of the minotaur

children.name: Thalia
children.description: goddess of festive celebrations and rich and luxurious banquets (charites; χάριτες)

children.name: Calliope
children.description: muse of epic poetry

children.name: Clio
children.description: muse of history

children.name: Urania
children.description: muse of astronomy

children.name: Charon
children.description: ferryman of hades

children.name: Minos
children.description: former mortal king of crete and judge of the final vote

children.name: Electra
children.description: goddess of the star cluster pleiades and were associated with rain (pleiades; πλειάδες)

children.name: Iris
children.description: goddess of the rainbow and divine messenger

children.name: Maia
children.description: goddess of the star cluster pleiades and were associated with rain (pleiades; πλειάδες)

children.name: Heracles
children.description: son of zeus and alcmena, a renowned hero, known for accomplishing the twelve labors as penance for the murder of his family.

children.name: Perseus
children.description: son of zeus and danae, slayer of the gorgon medusa and rescuer of andromeda

children.name: Inachus
children.description: a river god, father of io and phoroneus

children.name: Persephone
children.description: queen of the underworld, wife of hades and goddess of spring growth

children.name: Acrisius
children.description: king of argos, father of Danae and grandfather of the famous demi-god perseus

children.name: Agenor
children.description: phoenician king of tyre or sidon

children.name: Diomedes
children.description: he was the ruler of the warlike tribe of bistones and is known for his man-eating horses, which Heracles stole for his twelve labours, slaying diomedes in the process

children.name: Menelaus
children.description: king of sparta, husband of helen, and a prominent figure in the trojan war

children.name: Oeagrus
children.description: king of thrace, father of orpheus with the muse calliope

children.name: Romulus
children.description: founder and first king of rome, twin brother of remus

children.name: Thestius
children.description: was a legendary founder and king of thespiae, boeotia

children.name: Tyndareus
children.description: king of Sparta, was the husband of leda, with whom he had a number of children, including castor and clytemnestra

children.name: Alcmene
children.description: wife of Amphitryon,mainly known for being the mother of the demigod hero heracles

children.name: Castor
children.description: was a demigod, one of the dioscuri, a pair of twin brothers. unlike his brother, he is a mortal due to their fathers different backgrounds

children.name: Orpheus
children.description: legendary musician, poet, and prophet in greek mythology

children.name: Remus
children.description: twin brother of romulus, the legendary co-founder of rome

children.name: Ariadne
children.description: was a cretan princess,known for helping theseus escape the minotaur and being abandoned by him on the island of naxos.

children.name: Cyrene
children.description: a mortal princess, daughter of king hypseus, king of the lapiths. she was abducted by apollo

children.name: Danae
children.description: was an argive princess and mother of the hero perseus by zeus, who came to her in the form of golden rain

children.name: Europa
children.description: was a phoenician princess from tyre and the mother of king minos of crete. the continent of europe was named after her.

children.name: Helen
children.description: the most beautiful woman of greece and the indirect cause of the trojan war. she was daughter of zeus and leda

children.name: Hermione
children.description: daughter of menelaus and helen, princess of sparta

children.name: Leda
children.description: queen of sparta, mother of helen of troy by zeus who seduced her when he took the form of a swan

children.name: Semele
children.description: was a princess of thebes, seduced by zeus in the guise of an eagle, she gave birth to dionysus

children.name: Telephassa
children.description: queen of phoenicia, daughter of the god Nilus

children.name: Phoenix
children.description: was the eponym of Phoenicia who together with his brothers were tasked to find their abducted sister europa.

children.name: Atlas
children.description: titan forced to carry the heavens upon his shoulders by zeus

children.name: Dione
children.description: titaness of the oracle of dodona

children.name: Eos
children.description: titaness of the dawn

children.name: Helios
children.description: titan of the sun and guardian of oaths

children.name: Leto
children.description: titaness of motherhood and mother of the twin olympians, artemis and apollo

children.name: Metis
children.description: titaness of good counsel, advice, planning, cunning, craftiness, and wisdom

children.name: Pallas
children.description: titan of warcraft

children.name: Perses
children.description: titan of destruction

children.name: Prometheus
children.description: titan of forethought and crafty counsel, and creator of mankind

children.name: Selene
children.description: titaness of the moon

children.name: Styx
children.description: titaness of the underworld river styx and personification of hatred

children.name: Coeus
children.description: titan of intellect and the axis of heaven around which the constellations revolved

children.name: Creus
children.description: least individualized of the twelve titans, he is the father of astraeus, pallas, and perses

children.name: Hyperion
children.description: titan of light

children.name: Iapetus
children.description: titan of mortality and father of prometheus, epimetheus, menoetius, and atlas

children.name: Mnemnosyne
children.description: titaness of memory and mother of the muses with zeus

children.name: Oceanus
children.description: titan of the all-encircling river oceans around the earth, the fount of all the earths fresh-water

children.name: Phoebe
children.description: titaness of the bright intellect and prophecy, and consort of koios

children.name: Rhea
children.description: titaness of fertility, motherhood and the mountain wilds

children.name: Tethys
children.description: titaness of fresh-water, and the mother of the rivers, springs, streams, fountains, and clouds

children.name: Thea
children.description: was one of the titans and a deity of immense beauty and brightness

children.name: Themis
children.description: titaness of divine law and order

children.name: Bia
children.description: personification of force and raw energy

children.name: Cer
children.description: they were the goddesses who personified violent death and who were drawn to bloody deaths on battlefields.

children.name: Dike
children.description: spirit of justice, fair judgement, and the rights established by custom and law

children.name: Eris
children.description: spirit of strife, discord, contention, and rivalry

children.name: Harmonia
children.description: goddess of harmony and concord

children.name: Moros
children.description: spirit of doom

children.name: Nike
children.description: goddess of victory
